item.description: comparing frequencies height of bar =~ frequency

item.title: changing a variable
item.description: Used when we want to examen a new dataset that is based on a previous dataset Can be used to easily determine the average (by subtracting a value somewhat in the middle of the datapoints) → positive and negative values generally cancel out

item.description: flow the value of the variable may be anything

item.description: [[mode]]: Ø → [[modal class]] [[median]]: estimate middle class → midpoint [[mean]]: estimate middle value $\cdot$ frequency

item.description: step by step a variable may only hold a value at certain increments

item.title: Graphs
item.description: [[Pie charts]] [[Bar graph]] [[Line graph]] [[Histogram]]

item.title: Histogram
item.description: distributing data into classes height of bar ~ frequency in classes [!important] Frequency polygon height of the bars connected → shows the trend that the data follows

item.title: Line graph
item.description: displaying tendencies height of points =~ frequency → connected

item.title: mean
item.description: Q: What is the mean of a dataset? the sum of the data dicided by the number of data points $$\bar{x}=\frac{x_1+x_2+…+x_n}{n}=\frac{1}{n}\cdot \sum_{i=1}^nx_i$$

item.title: median
item.description: Q: What is the median of a dataset? the value(s) with the highest frequency

item.title: modal class
item.description: [!info] This page does not exist (yet)!

item.title: mode
item.description: Q: What is the mode of a dataset? the middle number when the data are in order $\tilde{x}$

item.title: mode, median, mean examples
item.description: Example 1 mode: 3,7 median: $$3,3,5,6,7,7,8,9$$ $$\tilde{x}=\frac{6+7}{2}=6.5$$ mean: 6 Example 2 value [[frequency]] 1 1 2 2 3 3 4 5 5 3 6 1 [[mode]]: 4 [[median]]: 4 (#8) [[mean]]: $\bar{x}=\frac{1\cdot 1+2\cdot 2+3\cdot 3+5\cdot 4+3\cdot 5+1\cdot 6}{15}=\frac{11}{3}$

item.title: Pie charts
item.description: comparing [[relative frequency]] angle at the center is proportional to the relative frequency

item.title: Sample
item.description: a sample may be random or biased

item.title: spread
item.description: Range the difference between its extreme values Percentiles divide the range into 100 equal parts First and third quartiles the points below lies 25% and 75% of the data respectively

item.title: Statistics
item.description: the collection, analysis, representation and interpretation of data
